sentences.sContent: They measure skin conductance, or sweating response.
sentences.sContent_eng: They measure skin conductance, or sweating response.
sentences.sCn: 这些措施皮肤电导，或出汗的反应。

sentences.sContent: Most studies of physiology-based measurements of pain have focused on heart rate, skin conductance and EEG.
sentences.sContent_eng: Most studies of physiology-based measurements of pain have focused on heart rate, skin conductance and EEG.
sentences.sCn: 大多数基于生理的疼痛测量研究都聚焦于心率、皮肤电导和脑电图。

sentences.sContent: These, say the researchers, correspond to drops in conductance when DNA strands slide across the gap via a biochemical process known as translocation.
sentences.sContent_eng: These, say the researchers, correspond to drops in conductance when DNA strands slide across the gap via a biochemical process known as translocation.
sentences.sCn: 研究人员认为这是由于DNA链通过时产生了一种叫做易位的生化过程，使得石墨烯的电导发生了下降。

words.tran: 传导的；传导性的；有传导力的
导体；售票员；领导者；管理人
导电性；[物][生理] 传导性
女向导；女车长；女指挥；女售票员

trans.tranOther: the ability of a system to conduct electricity, measured by the ratio of the current flowing through the system to the potential difference across it; the reciprocal of resistance
